ygData.subject: Re: Stamina question??
ygData.msgSnippet: Your barb freind must have been awful weak.  at 16th level with a 110 sta (only +5 from base) i have 494hp Bashlor the Barb of Bertox
ygData.messageBody:
Your barb freind must have been awful weak. at 16th level with a 110
sta (only +5 from base) i have 494hp

Bashlor the Barb of Bertox

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mifsud, Michael [SMTP:Michael.Mifsud@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 2:07 AM
> To: 'warriors_eq@onelist.com'
> Subject: [warriors_eq] Stamina question??
>
> From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
>
> Has anyone figured out how stamina affects hp?? I know at level one
> theres
> not much difference between the standard stamina and a bumped up
> stamina,
> but as the levels progress theres a BIG difference.
>
> Example compare your vanilla troll warrior and vanilla barbarian
> warrior.
> At level 20 the troll will have aprox 780hp at level 22 the barbarian
> will
> have aprox 666hp. Im taking this information from 2 people I know.
> So
> obviously the higher natural stamina does really affect hp over time.
>
> So has anyone figured out a ration? Or any word from Verant how it
> actually
> works? At the moment all we have (which is fine) is that more stamina
> =
> more hp at HIGHER levels. The higher the levels become the greater
> the
> divergence.
>
> Wonder if people would mind telling us there stamina, level and hp?
>
> My character has a stamina of 75 and at level 18 she has exactly
> 500hp.
>
> ----------------------------------------------------------------------
> --
> ONElist: where the world talks!
> http://www.onelist.com
> Join a new list today.
> ----------------------------------------------------------------------
> --
> For the Honor and Glory of the Warlord, Rallos Zek!
